intro: Dracaena poubellei, commonly known as the Poubelle dracaena, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which are typically borne at the base of the plant. Dracaena poubellei is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and prefers bright, indirect light. It is a relatively low-maintenance plant, making it popular as a houseplant.
